title: Madison Square Park
location: 23rd Street to 26th Street, between 5th & Madison Avenue
short_description: Open all year-round, Madison Square Park is an urban park located in the center of Flatiron and NoMad. During the summer, this outdoor space becomes one the city's hottest destinations with an array of art and music series, culinary events, and a great place to sit back, relax and absorb the amazing view of the Flatiron Building and Empire State Building.
more_content:
Steps away from The Evelyn is the popular Madison Square Park. Built in 1847, this outdoor space hosts various temporary art exhibits, concert series and food events for all visitors who enjoy green spaces. This summer events include Madison Square Eats, Madison Square Art 34th Annual- "Prismatic Park" Installation by Josiah McElheny, and more! 

 

Shake Shack at Madison Square Park

The popular, fast food chain- Shake Shack, known for its burgers, fries and of course shakes first started its business here at Madison Square Park! Shake Shack started as a hot dog cart in Madison Square Park to support the Madison Square Park Conservancy’s first art installation “I ‚ù§ Taxi.” Due to its popular success, Shake Shack expanded its business throughout New York City. For more information, please visit their official website. 

 

Prismatic Park Art Installation by Josiah McElheny 

Madison Square Park Conservancy will announce its 34th exhibition, Prismatic Park by artist and MacArthur Foundation Fellow recipient, Josiah McElheny. The outdoor exhibition will be available from June 13th, 2017 through October 8th, 2017. For more information, please visit their official website.

 

Madison Square Eats Fall Market

Urban Space brings back Madison Square Eats from September 2nd, 2017 through September 29th, 2017. Explore some of the city's best restaurants at Worth Square, in the middle of Flatiron District. For more information on participating vendors, please visit their official website.
